docs.snippet: The United States’ new steel and aluminum tariffs are prompting trade barriers as foreign governments look to prevent a flood of cheap metals.

docs.snippet: The geneticist at Harvard Medical School has retrieved DNA from more than 900 ancient people. His findings trace the prehistoric migrations of our species.

headline.main: David Reich Unearths Human History Etched in Bone

docs.snippet: The real fight is over China’s financial support for its high-tech sector, which could help the country develop cutting-edge industries. Beijing says it will stand firm.

headline.print_headline: China’s State-Backed Tech Is Major Trade Sore Spot for U.S.
headline.main: The Trade Issue That Most Divides U.S. and China Isn’t Tariffs

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump isn't always bringing genuine statistics to the fight as he goes after China on trade.

headline.main: AP FACT CHECK: Trump Off Base on Trade Stats With China

docs.snippet: Police and politicians backed by the country's former strongman President Mahinda Rajapaksa joined anti-Muslim riots that rocked Sri Lanka's Kandy district this month, according to witnesses, officials and CCTV footage reviewed by Reuters.

headline.print_headline: Police, Politicians Accused of Joining Sri Lanka's Anti-Muslim Riots

docs.snippet: Getting rid of your Facebook account will only offload the platform’s problems onto someone else.

headline.main: Don’t Delete Facebook. Do Something About It.

docs.snippet: In our authoritarian age, the pope offers a different model of power.

Factbox on major ball-tampering incidents in cricket after in the wake of the ongoing probe into the Australian team for attempting to alter the state of the ball during the third day of the third test against South Africa:
After years of testing, the halo, meant to protect a drivers head, is making its debut in Melbourne. Some teams hate the device.

headline.print_headline: A new era of protecting drivers
headline.main: At the Australian Grand Prix, a New Era of Protecting Drivers
